Реферат на тему диссертации: «Природа электричества и гравитации».
До сих пор наука не в состоянии ответить на вопросы – что первично, какова природа эфира, гравитации, электричества, сверхпроводимости, дуальности ЭЧ и т.д. Это результат ошибочной концепции Н. Бора о строении атомов, которая является всего лишь никем не доказанным предположением. Наоборот.
Согласно Э. Шрёдингера в атомах нет электронов, а есть волны. Согласно А. Эйнштейна «Элементарные частицы — это сгущения электромагнитного поля», «То, что действует на наши чувства в виде вещества, есть на деле огромная концентрация энергии в сравнительно малом пространстве», «Основным элементом, или кирпичиком, реальности следует вместо массы считать поле… переход от массы к полю». Э. Ферми утверждал: «В атомах нет элементарных частиц – они образуются вне атомов».
Исходя из того, что любой атом, любая клетка излучает определённый спектр ЭМ волн - согласно Э. Шрёдингеру в атомах находятся ЭМ волны, которые согласно Д. К. Максвелла и Г. Герца двигаются самостоятельно безконечно долго даже в безвоздушном пространстве. Двигаться в конкретном объёме можно только вращаясь вокруг оси. А так как ЭМ волны состоят из электрической и магнитной энергий – вращение эл. энергии создаёт замкнутое магнитное поле в виде сферы, являющейся границей атомов и клеток. А вращение маг. энергии создаёт на концах оси вращения ЭДС.
Таким образом – атомы и клетки представляют собой маленькие магнитики и батарейки. Множество магнитиков в составе планет создаёт единое магнитное поле, именуемой гравитационным. А последовательное расположение маленьких ЭДС под воздействием внешнего магнитного поля создаёт на концах провода суммарную ЭДС, которая при замыкании создаёт электрический ток.

I have to disagree with you here, since you spread the most common misconception about gravity in this video, making it look as if gravity was "a force pulling us towards the earth" ( 0:57 ) - which is not the case !
If gravity was pulling objects towards the earth, objects in free fall would be truly accelerating downwards - and therefore NOT be weightless in the process of acceleration (!) since acceleration creates "weight", so to speak.
But falling objects are indeed weightless (!) , which tells us that it is not the object that is being accelerated DOWNWARDS, but it is US, the observers, being constantly accelerated UPWARDS, due to the curvature in our local patch of space-time bent by the mass of our planet. The acceleration you witness when you drop something is "fake", the falling object doesn't feel any force acting on it at all, and especially no "gravitational pull", and is NOT accelerating at all. It is this "fake acceleration" which proves the existence of the gravitational field, because no classical force could do this trick.
I whish you could include this bit of info in your video, because it is the very core of the weird effect called "gravity".

It is a great debate opportunity that this site has created and my utmost gratitude is conveyed at first.
Sir Isaac Newton has explained only the physical parameters of the phenomenon called Gravity. The phenomenon is explained if only the mechanism behind 'how Gravity attracts things' is explained. And the scientists of the mediator period have made it more complex to become a paradox by their philosophic definitions which could never be proven practically or mathematically. I firmly believe Scientists of the 21st century can solve this paradox unless they really want to conserve it as a paradox for the future generations to solve. 

Students of logical thinking should ask the questions; 
1. Why Gravity does only attract things and why it doesn't repel ? 
2. Why Gravity attract only 'atomic mass' and why not 'energy mass' like photon, electrons, solar wind etc? 

Before answering above questions we have to clarify 'what are the three fundamental space matter?' Soils, Liquids and gasses must be the sure answer from a student of junior secondary level. But we know that are the three phases of the atomic mass.Then what matter is electron's, light and heat etc? Do not they posses a mass? That category of matter has to be recognized as 'Energy Mass'. Solar wind too belongs to that category because it is made up of weakly charged  energy particles emitted from Sun. Then what is the third category of fundamental space matter? It is the 'Space Medium Matter'. The space is densely filled with this invisible static matter and it has a density and a pressure.

Now only the mechanism of Gravity can be explained because the different behaviour of energy waves and energy rays could not be distinguished until a space medium of matter is accepted. Energy rays like light, heat X-ray etc. dont need a medium to travel because they are line projection of energy particles like photons. But waves such as, natural sounds, electromagnetic FM or AM sounds, TV etc always need a medium to travel.

Gravity too is due to a medium wave and how could it born? 
Put a fly in to a calm water and you would observe tiny waves round and round. That is how atomic masses produce gravitational wave in the space medium. A single atom can be considered as a rotary engine in which electron clouds are rotating round the nucleus. Any rotary machine in the world makes a vibration and a bigger collection of atomic mass makes a stronger vibration to transmit a stronger wave through the medium. That is how the gravitational waves are born but how on earth it can attract another mass?

When the wave strike upon any secondary atom in the field, the rotating electron cloud is a bit pushed more closer to the nucleus from the direction at where the wave strikes from. Thence the Coulomb's electromagnetic force at the side of wave strike becomes bigger and the resultant force makes the atom move towards the gravity source. Electrons and photons are not responded by gravity because they don't have internal rotary systems to be affected. 

Other most important thing is that, dynamic behaviour of gravitational fields has not yet even touched. Only the static gravitation was explained in Newtonian Mechanics.But you know Sun is rotating and its gravitational field is not static at all. Therefore the gravity of Sun is deviated due to rotation and as a result an orbital motive force is applied upon planets to orbit in the same direction of Suns rotation.

However ultimately the credit of Gravity has to be shared with Coulomb too because his electromagnetism could explain the mechanism of so mysterious magical force of gravity.

That is the point.  Mass is irrelevant with regards to the acceleration due to gravity. 

You can't say that "gravity has nothing to do with mass".

You CAN say that the ACCELERATION due to gravity has nothing to do with mass.  The FORCE of gravity does depend on mass, but since there is a such thing as inertia, the more mass an object has, the more inertia it has - the harder it is to accelerate, so it requires a greater force to accelerate a more massive object at the same rate as a lesser massive object.  This proportionality here is in balance.  All objects will accelerate at the same rate because the force is greater on greater masses, but it requires that much more force to accelerate it at the same rate.

Let me pose this quesiton though: When two objects of different mass are in free fall with no air resistance they both accelerate at exactly the same speed. the acceleration is due to gravity of course. But if they both do it at the same speed but with different masses then doesn't this mean that mass is negligible? And therefore gravity really has nothing to do with mass at all.

For the intelligent collective here, having watched this 'nothing new' video and still asking "What is gravity?", I'll give you my 2-cents which is my theory but, I believe, a credible one. First, gravity isn't the product of gravitons (particle physicist's compartmentalisation for the 'standard model'), and gravity does not distort (dilate) time, but it is the dilation of time in the presence of matter and motion that creates gravity and inertia. Universal laws endeavour to unite everything to a singularity - meaning 'nothing' - including time itself, and therefore uniting bodies to within the same reference time-frame, and so we have gravity - not too dissimilar from surface tension on water. Consider gravity from that perspective then you can start to unify gravity, inertia, photons, energy, etc. Taking this further, I believe the traditional notion of a black hole having gravitational force where not even light can 'escape' is the product of misguided science - particularly as gravitational force is mostly attributed to a dense neutron mass at its centre, yet we have enormous x-ray radiation along the perfect axis which is simplistically dismissed as... "a lensing effect" at the border of the event horizon. HOWEVER, consider conservation of motion and the rapid rotation of that dense neutron mass where, therefore, time dilation imposed by surface velocity of the nucleus simply cannot be ignored. When particles approach the black hole the electrons are 'squeezed out' under what we observe as gravitational force, but the resulting quantum's of energy are absorbed and projected forward in time through incredible time dilation due to the spinning core. Unlike a pure vortex however, the speed of spin of a mass approaches zero as you move towards the axis of rotation, therefore diminishing time dilation to near zero - allowing us to observe intense X-radiation as it effectively stacks up and ejects from the black hole along its axis. Much of the radiation we observe today may be attributed to atomic energy rapidly projected forward in time to our time, from millions (or billions) of years in the past. The blackness of the black hole can be attributed to time dilation, where light intensity (let's say... photons per second) reduces as we observe time dilation through the slow-down in the presence of high gravitational field - as covered in the video. As time dilation increases, the number of photons per second decreases, until we have 'blackness'. I accept my theories are just that, but what is there to suggest that it's this mysterious 'gravity' and not time that governs our universal laws - particularly as established mathematics holds true.

The thing is that we don't take rest energy into account or that we only take rest mass into account on Newtonian level. And if we take Newtonian gravitational law and only consider rest mass and don't count rest energy as energy, than we find that it doesn't hold for particles with zero rest mass.

I wouldn't say that claiming "gravity is an attraction between objects with mass" is lying. In STR there are two kinds of mass, rest mass and relativistic mass. Objects with relativistic energy always have relativistic mass, so claiming that gravity is an attraction between objects with energy is the same as claiming that gravity is an attraction between objects with mass in this case. Of course it's true, that even objects with zero rest mass (for example photons) are affected by gravity.

As for the moon, it can get complicated getting into the details, but basically there is something called a tidal force (it causes tides).  The force of gravity from the moon is stronger on the side of Earth facing the moon.  This creates a sort of bulge on the Earth (tides) as the moon orbits the Earth.  This bulge, however is slightly ahead of the moon in its orbit, and this, in a way, slings the moon into a higher orbit (tiny amount).  A fair amount of scientists agree that this will stop.

Important to note, that while you would return from Earth if you fell from 215,000 miles, you would not survive unless you had heat shields, parachutes, etc.  You would be going over 20,000 mph by the time you reached the Earth's atmosphere and would surely burn up pretty quickly!  You only asked how high before he wouldn't fall back down; nothing about surviving.  To survive (not burn up), not really all that much higher than where he jumped from.  Maybe twice as far; maybe a little more...

In reality, eventually, the farther you get from Earth, even though the Earth would technically still have an influence on you, Mars, Jupiter, certainly the Sun, etc. would then be having a significant influence on you as well.  It would be unlikely that you would fall back to Earth.  The farthest you could probably go would be somewhere between the Earth and moon, where the Earth's influence is still more than the moon.  ROUGH calculations give me about 345,000 km (215,000 miles) high.

Though, you would certainly never survive long enough to fall all the way back to Earth (or even get there in the first place!).  From that far out (again ignoring other gravitational influences), it would take almost 160 million years to orbit the Earth.  That is why this question is hard to answer.  Knowing this, a better question would be something like, "How far CAN the jumper go, and still be able to fall back to Earth AND survive"  The answer to this question is as far as he CAN go.

That's pretty hard to anwer.  First, it doesn't matter how much you weigh, or even what your mass is.  Gravity accelerates you the same amount it accelerates a golf ball.  The force of gravity is weaker the farther you are from the center of the Earth, and there is no 'point of no return'. Technically, if you were 1 trillion kilometers from Earth (and there were no other gravitational forces involved...) There still exists an escape velocity of a little under 1 m/s (you still haven't excaped).

Be careful about your terms here:  "ID" refers to more than just the evolution of life.  It commonly refers to the appearance of life ("abiogenesis", in science) and the creation of the universe. Your invented life form would not show the nested hierarchies
evident in evolved relationships we see in ALL biology.  Don't tell us what an 'evolutionist' would do if you don't know what they have already done.

You're thinking of quantum gravity - on macroscopic scales, general relativity's picture of gravity as a geometric phenomenon work perfectly.  However, trying to quantize doesn't work too well.  So, many physicists believed that on microscopic scales, gravity should be carried by gravitons.  This leads to a model called string theory.

However, string theory is no longer as popular.  Loop quantum gravity describes quantum gravity without gravitons, and with geometry, like general relativity.

Space doesn't curve in GR, spacetime does.  Since you have a non-negotiable, forced motion through time, you're always moving through spacetime.  So, when our rock suddenly appears, all of its motion through spacetime is in the time direction.   However, spacetime is curved near of the earth.  So, part of the rock's motion through time becomes motion through space.  Because motion through time is forced, so is this motion through space - which is why you can't shield yourself from gravity.

This is true. Gravity is still a theory. It's a theory with a lot of maths behind it, but a theory nonetheless. There are 4 major forces (fundamental interactions); electromagnetic force, weak nuclear force, strong nuclear force and gravity. Electromagnetism, weak nuclear force and strong nuclear force have a particle associated with them, which are photons, bosons and gluons respectively. But gravity doesn't have a known particle. I think this is pretty much why it's still a theory.

We've understood gravity for about 100 years.  General relativity, discovered by Einstein, has passed rigorous experimental tests.  GR describes gravity as objects trying to follow straight lines (geodesics) through curved spacetime.

Gravity distorts space-time, which is why gravity bends light or even pulls it in completely in the case of a black hole.
Mass or not, anything passing through space-time is affected by gravity.

In Newtonian gravity, the pull would be there instantly, and the strength of the force would grow exponentially with time (As they got closer, the force gets stronger.)

But when Einstein replaced Newtonian gravity with general relativity, we know that gravity travels as a ripple through space at the speed of light - so we would first have to wait for the gravitational waves to reach each other, and then it would continue as Newton believed - getting exponentially stronger with time.

@beastlyonion I was trying to figure out a way to understand it.  For this example, consider gravity like water in a lake.. It is always there.  If a boat passes through the water it creates a wake.  Consider the boat moving through the water as "lifting something up".  The boat creates a wake and allows the boat to move through it.  When we lift something up or jump, gravity simply "flexes" to allow this but like the water, it is always there, always pulling...

@xbox360dude0 We never actually break gravity, it simply moves out of the way when we jump or lift something, much like water moves out of the way when a boat moves through it.  Consider gravity as the water, always there, yet the boat can move through it.  Once the boat is gone, gravity fills back in the wake.  So gravity can not really be broken, it can be manipulated.  Gravity only pulls with a force equal to the weight of the object.
